info.title: Firefly APIs
info.description: REST API for Adobe Firefly for enterprise usage

post.description: Generate images based on a prompt with optional reference image to match style and structure.

validation_errors.msg: value is not a valid enumeration member; permitted: 'photo', 'art'

requestBody.description: Upload source image or mask image of types PNG/JPEG/WEBP for Image-to-Image operations, such as  fill, expand. This api returns an identifier that is used to refer to uploaded content.

post.description: Generate similar Images based on the reference image.

validation_errors.msg: value is not a valid enumeration member; permitted: 'photo', 'art'

post.description: Change the aspect ratio or size of an image and expand its contents with or without a text prompt.

validation_errors.msg: value is not a valid enumeration member; permitted: 'photo', 'art'

post.description: Fill the masked area of an image with an optional prompt.

validation_errors.msg: value is not a valid enumeration member; permitted: 'photo', 'art'

post.description: Upload an image(with or without mask), such as a product photo, and utilize a text prompt to generate a seamlessly composited scene featuring the product.

validation_errors.msg: value is not a valid enumeration member; permitted: 'photo', 'art'

AlignmentHorizontal.title: AlignmentHorizontal
AlignmentHorizontal.description: Specifies the horizontal anchoring of the image within the available space.

AlignmentVertical.title: AlignmentVertical
AlignmentVertical.description: Specifies the vertical anchoring of the image within the available space.

ApiError.title: ApiError
ApiError.description: The error within the error response.

source.title: Source image
source.description:
Source of the reference image used to generate similar images. You can either use a url or an uploadId as the source for the uploaded image. Note: Only allow listed domains are allowed to be accepted as input URL in the request. The allow-listed domains are as follows:
  • amazonaws.com
  • windows.net
  • dropboxusercontent.com

BaseInputImage.title: BaseInputImage
BaseInputImage.description: Source image which will be used to generate similar images

ContentClass.title: ContentClass
ContentClass.description:
The content class guides the overall image theme and styles can be applied on top of each content type. If no content type is specified, it is auto-detected. 
 | Value | Description
 |:---------- |:------
 | photo | Photorealistic style
 | art | Artistic style

numVariations.title: The number of variations
numVariations.description: The number of variations to generate. numVariations will default to the number of seeds, or to 1 if seeds is not specified.

seeds.title: The seed of each variation
seeds.description: Array of seed(s) that ensure consistent image generation across multiple API calls. For example, you can use the same seed to generate a similar image with different styles. If specified alongside with numVariations, the number of seeds must be the equal to numVariations

size.description: Specifies the desired width and height for the final, expanded image.

prompt.title: Prompt
prompt.description: The prompt used to generate the image. The longer the prompt - the better

image.title: Input image
image.description:
The image to be expanded. You can either use a url or an uploadId as the source for the uploaded image. Note: Only allow listed domains are allowed to be accepted as input URL in the request. The allow-listed domains are as follows:
  • amazonaws.com
  • windows.net
  • dropboxusercontent.com

placement.title: Object placement
placement.description:
Specifies how the source image will be positioned and sized in the final generation. The value should describe the placement and dimensions of the image within the output.

Note: Placement for source images cannot be used when a mask image is being applied.

size.title: The actual size used for the outputs
size.description: If size was passed as input, this value should be the same as the one passed as input.

outputs.title: The list of images
outputs.description: Each image will have a storage item.

source.title: Source image
source.description: Source of the image to be expanded.

mask.title: Mask image
mask.description: Defines the expanding area where the source image should expand towards. Mask has to be larger than the source image, and the target size has to match the size of the mask, or it will be inferred from the mask.

numVariations.title: The number of variations
numVariations.description: The number of variations to generate. numVariations will default to the number of seeds, or to 1 if seeds is not specified.

seeds.title: The seed of each variation
seeds.description: Array of seed(s) that ensure consistent image generation across multiple API calls. For example, you can use the same seed to generate a similar image with different styles. If specified alongside with numVariations, the number of seeds must be the equal to numVariations

prompt.title: The prompt
prompt.description: The prompt used to generate the image. The longer the prompt - the better

negativePrompt.title: Avoid prompt
negativePrompt.description: Inference will try to generate against this prompt

image.title: Input Image
image.description:
Input image to fill with generative content. You can either use a url or an uploadId as the source for the uploaded image. Note: Only allow listed domains are allowed to be accepted as input URL in the request. The allow-listed domains are as follows:
  • amazonaws.com
  • windows.net
  • dropboxusercontent.com

promptBiasingLocaleCode.title: The locale used for image generations
promptBiasingLocaleCode.description: A hyphen-separated string combining the ISO 639-1 language code and the ISO 3166-1 region, such as "en-US". When a locale is set, the prompt will be biased to generate more relevant content for that region. The locale will be auto-detected if not specified based on the user's profile and Accept-Language header.

size.title: The actual size used for the outputs
size.description: If size was passed as input, this value should be the same as the one passed as input.

outputs.title: The list of images
outputs.description: Each image will have a storage item.

numVariations.title: The number of variations
numVariations.description: The number of variations to generate. numVariations will default to the number of seeds, or to 1 if seeds is not specified.

seeds.title: The seed of each variation
seeds.description: Array of seed(s) that ensure consistent image generation across multiple API calls. For example, you can use the same seed to generate a similar image with different styles. If specified alongside with numVariations, the number of seeds must be the equal to numVariations.

size.title: The size
size.description:
The size of the requested generations. The supported dimensions for image generations are: 
  | Dimensions | Description | 
  | -----------| ----- |
  | { "width": 2048, "height": 2048} | Square (1:1) |
  | { "width": 2304, "height": 1792 } | Landscape (4:3) |
  | { "width": 1792, "height": 2304 } | Portrait (3:4) | 
  | { "width": 2688, "height": 1536 } | Widescreen (16:9) |  
  | { "width": 1344, "height": 768 } |(7:4) |  
  |{ "width": 1152, "height": 896 } |(9:7) |  
  |{ "width": 896, "height": 1152 } |(7:9) |  
  | { "width": 1024, "height": 1024} | Square (1:1) |

prompt.title: The prompt
prompt.description: The prompt used to generate the image. The longer the prompt - the better.

negativePrompt.title: Avoid prompt
negativePrompt.description: Inference will try to generate against this prompt.

contentClass.title: The content class
contentClass.description: Will guide the generation to being more photographic or more like art.

visualIntensity.title: Visual Intensity
visualIntensity.description: Adjusts the overall intensity of your photo's existing visual characteristics.

style.title: The styles to be used for image generation
style.description: You can specify a preset, a reference image or both.

promptBiasingLocaleCode.title: The locale used for image generations
promptBiasingLocaleCode.description: A hyphen-separated string combining the ISO 639-1 language code and the ISO 3166-1 region, such as "en-US". When a locale is set, the prompt will be biased to generate more relevant content for that region. The locale will be auto-detected if not specified based on the user's profile and Accept-Language header.

tileable.title: Output image tileability
tileable.description: An image is tileable if it can be repeated infinitely in any direction without showing visible seams or edges.

structure.title: Structure Reference
structure.description: Use structure to ensure the generated image maintains a similar layout and organization as the reference image, providing a cohesive and visually balanced result.

size.title: The actual size used for the outputs
size.description: If size was passed as input, this value should be the same as the one passed as input.

outputs.title: The list of images
outputs.description: Each image will have a storage item.

promptHasDeniedWords.title: The prompt had denied words
promptHasDeniedWords.description: The user may see that the generation does not comply to its full prompt

promptHasBlockedArtists.title: The prompt had artists that were blocked
promptHasBlockedArtists.description: The user may see that the generation does not comply to its full prompt

contentClass.title: The detected content class
contentClass.description: Will be same as input, if input was specified

numVariations.title: The number of variations
numVariations.description: The number of variations to generate. numVariations will default to the number of seeds, or to 1 if seeds is not specified.

seeds.title: The seed of each variation
seeds.description: Array of seed(s) that ensure consistent image generation across multiple API calls. For example, you can use the same seed to generate a similar image with different styles. If specified alongside with numVariations, the number of seeds must be the equal to numVariations

size.title: The size
size.description:
The size of the requested generations. The supported dimensions for image generations are: 
  | Dimensions | Description | 
  | -----------| ----- |
  | { "width": 2048, "height": 2048} | Square (1:1) |
  | { "width": 2304, "height": 1792 } | Landscape (4:3) |
  | { "width": 1792, "height": 2304 } | Portrait (3:4) | 
  | { "width": 2688, "height": 1536 } | Widescreen (16:9) |  
  | { "width": 1344, "height": 768 } |(7:4) |  
  |{ "width": 1152, "height": 896 } |(9:7) |  
  |{ "width": 896, "height": 1152 } |(7:9) |

image.title: Input Image
image.description:
An image of an object that needs to be rendered on a scene. You can either use a url or an uploadId as the source for the uploaded image. Note: Only allow listed domains are allowed to be accepted as input URL in the request. The allow-listed domains are as follows:
  • amazonaws.com
  • windows.net
  • dropboxusercontent.com

prompt.title: The prompt
prompt.description: The prompt used to generate the image. The longer the prompt - the better

placement.title: Object placement
placement.description: Specifies how the image will be positioned and sized in the final generation. You can specify both inset and alignment, only inset, only alignment or none of them.

style.title: The styles to be used for image generation
style.description: You can specify a preset, a reference image or both

contentClass.title: The content class
contentClass.description: Will guide the generation to being more photographic or more like art

GenerateObjectCompositeRequest.title: Generate object composite from prompt request

size.title: The actual size used for the outputs
size.description: If size was passed as input, this value should be the same as the one passed as input.

outputs.title: The list of images
outputs.description: Each image will have a storage item.

contentClass.title: The detected content class
contentClass.description: Will be same as input, if input was specified

GenerateObjectCompositeResponse.description: Generating object composite from prompt response

image.title: Reference image
image.description: Firefly will generate similar variations based on the reference input image.

tileable.title: Output image tileability
tileable.description: An image is tileable if it can be repeated infinitely in any direction without showing visible seams or edges.

GenerateSimilarImagesRequest.title: Generating similar images from a reference image
GenerateSimilarImagesRequest.description: Generating similar images from a reference image

size.title: The actual size used for the outputs
size.description: If size was passed as input, this value should be the same as the one passed as input.

outputs.title: The list of images
outputs.description: Each image will have a storage item.

source.title: Source image
source.description: An image of an object that needs to be rendered on a scene.

mask.title: Mask image
mask.description: Provide a mask that hides part of the object like the background.

source.title: Input image
source.description: Upload an image you want to fill.

mask.title: Mask image
mask.description:
Mask image which will be used replace the background of the image.
Note: The minimum accepted size for the larger side of the image is 600 px.

url.title: The presigned url
url.description: This URL of an uploaded image.

PublicBinaryInput.title: PublicBinaryInput
PublicBinaryInput.description: You can either use a url or an uploadId as the source for the uploaded image.

url.title: The presigned url
url.description: The reference to signed url of the image.

PublicBinaryOutput.title: PublicBinaryOutput
PublicBinaryOutput.description: A valid storage item containing a pre-signed URL. The pre-signed URL will expire in one hour.

seed.title: The seed used for the generation
seed.description: Identifier used to customize image generation processes.

image.title: The pre-signed URL used to download the image
image.description: A valid storage item containing a pre-signed URL. The pre-signed URL will expire in one hour.

inset.title: Margin values in target size
inset.description: Defines the inward displacement applied to the image's edges. This parameter specifies the distance by which each edge of the image will be pushed inward, thereby reducing the visible area by the specified amount on all sides.

alignment.title: Alignment
alignment.description: Specifies how the image will be anchored within the available space for each direction. For horizontal, (0,1,2)=(center, left, right). For vertical, (0,1,2)=(center, top, bottom).

left.title: Left Inset
left.description: The space between left edge of the result image and left edge of the placed object image.

top.title: Top Inset
top.description: The space between top edge of the result image and top edge of the placed object image.

right.title: Right Inset
right.description: The space between right edge of the result image and right edge of the placed object image.

bottom.title: Bottom Inset
bottom.description: The space between bottom edge of the result image and bottom edge of the placed object image.

width.title: The desired width of the output image.

height.title: The desired height of the output image.

Size.description:
Dimensions of the generated image
  | Dimensions | Description | 
  | -----------| ----- |
  | { "width": 2048, "height": 2048} | Square (1:1) |
  | { "width": 2304, "height": 1792 } | Landscape (4:3) |
  | { "width": 1792, "height": 2304 } | Portrait (3:4) | 
  | { "width": 2688, "height": 1536 } | Widescreen (16:9) |
Size.title: Size

strength.title: Adherence Threshold
strength.description: Control the amount of adherence to the reference image when generating the image variations. 0 means no adherence. 100 means full adherence.

imageReference.title: A structure reference image
imageReference.description:
An image with a structure you want to use as a reference for generating image variations. Note: Only allow listed domains are allowed to be accepted as input URL in the request. The allow-listed domains are as follows:
  • amazonaws.com
  • windows.net
  • dropboxusercontent.com

presets.title: The style presets
presets.description: You can specify a preset ID for a style. Refer to Image Model Styles under Concepts for the list of supported Preset IDs.

strength.title: The strength of the style
strength.description: The strength of the style to be applied.

imageReference.title: A style image reference
imageReference.description:
Firefly will detect the style in the image and apply the same style in the generated image. Note: Only allow listed domains are allowed to be accepted as input URL in the request. The allow-listed domains are as follows:
  • amazonaws.com
  • windows.net
  • dropboxusercontent.com

images.description: Array of objects containing asset ID

id.description: ID associated with the asset (generate this ID using the upload API).
examples: REPLACE WITH STRING ID GENERATED FROM UPLOAD IMAGE API
